results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of permutations of k elements from [1..n] where adjacent values cannot be consecutive modulo n.
comment: In a convex n-gon, the number of paths using k-1 diagonals and k non-repeated vertices.
program: isok(s, p, n) = {my(w = vector(#s, k, s[p[k]])); for (i=1, #s-1, if (isokd(w[i+1] - w[i], n) == 1, return (0))); return (1);}
T(n, k) = {my(nb = 0); forsubset([n, k], s, for(i=1, k!, if (isok(s, numtoperm(k, i), n), nb++););); nb;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 21 2020
